column4: i need help with nautilus - it's freezing up and i don't know how to solve this problem.  please?
can you repeat the freezes doing certain actions?
yeah, trying to open any window from the standard menu bar or launching from terminal.   i have a couple folders on my desktop, and double-clicking on them seems not to freeze anything
what error so dyou get frmo the terminal?
i've been launching from the termnal using the command "nautilus" and it doesn't give an error - it just returns the prompt and launches a window - which loads no icons and freezes
hwilde55:    so where should i go from here?
ideas on how i should fix things then?
just want to make sure i didn't get forgotten - any ideas on how to fix my gnome / nautilus troubles?
i don't mind reinstalling gnome if that's likely to fix the problem (overkill as it may be).  can you tell me the best way to reinstall it?
I don't think it will fix it
ok - i appreciate the help you were able to give though.  thanks.
I suggest creating a new user, logging in with them and seeing if their fresh defaults work.
dr_willis:    ok, i'll give that a shot.   thanks.
so that tells us there's no reason for reinstalling gnome, its your own configuration ;)
how would i go about finding what's causing the problem?
